content:
I have made an experimental build of windows on CircleCI. The idea is that since we depend on CCI anyway, it would make sense to have everything there. You can see the results on the branch win-cci.

CCI announces that they build faster than appveyor. However, it looks like the other way, they are not that fast. Build logs here. I think the differerence is mostly about loading the dependencies. Not sure.

Anyway, having everything in one place might be worth it. Or?

Technically no problems with this. My concern would be for other developers wanting to build plugins. The documentation would need an overhaul. OTOH it would be one less builder to worry about. On balance a good move.
